results.title: The Vital signs and their inter-relation: body temperature, pulse, respiration, blood pressure
results.creator_credit: Willard Pictures and United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids
results.brief_description:
A study of the physiology of the respiratory, heat regulatory, and circulatory systems, and their inter-relation in normal functioning, as well as in deviations from the normal. How to ascertain and record the vital signs, the importance of making thorough and accurate observations, and how to take care of the apparatus necessary for these observations, is demonstrated.
Designed for use in the instruction of professional nurses.

results.title: The Vital link
results.creator_credit: Rank Audio Visual, M.J. Clark and W. J. Allen
results.brief_description: Examines the development of transport routes, how the preferred means of transport is usually a compromise between convenience, speed and cost and some of the problems caused by an ever increasing dependence on transport in our everyday lives.

results.title: The Vital conductor
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Quantum”.
This is the second program in Quantum’s occasional series ‘The Universe within’, featuring Karina Kelly and Geoffrey Burchfield. It describes the function performed by the liver and looks at its ability to regenerate.

results.title: The Visitor
results.brief_description: The Visitor is a dramatisation of Ray Bradbury’s science fiction short story. “Blood Rust” victims are exiled to the barren deserts of a quarantine planet to prevent spread of disease on Earth. When a new arrival at the distant colony displays a mystical ability to recreate memories of Earth in the minds of the outcasts, his gift becomes the target of envy and aggression.

results.title: The Visit to Victoria of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II and His Royal Highness the Duke of Edinburgh
results.brief_description: A unique record of an outstanding historical event, the arrival at Essendon Airport on 24 February 1954, of Queen Elizabeth and the Duke of Edinburgh and their subsequent tour of the State of Victoria. Photographed by a large team of professional cameramen, in privileged positions, the film contains such exclusive scenes as the opening of State Parliament and the Royal Command Performance at the Princess Theatre, visits to Hamilton, Benalla, Sale, Traralgon, Yallourn and Mildura; races at Flemington; Flinders Naval Depot; and The University of Melbourne. The film captures all the excitement of the great occasion and shows many interesting sidelights of the Royal progress throughout the State.

results.title: The Visit of the London Symphony Orchestra
results.brief_description: A record of the first Australian visit of the London Symphony Orchestra which performed at the 1966 Adelaide Festival of Arts. Later they visited Sydney where they were the first to play in the Sydney Opera House.

results.title: The Visit
results.creator_credit: BFI, John Hall and Jack Gold
results.brief_description: A searching study of suburban futility. Shows in painstaking and intricate detail the chilling, deadening aimlessness of an unmarried woman’s existence - an existence divided between the exhausting monotony of machine-minding and the nervous strain of caring for her stolid, vacant, fractious parents. The routine is broken by a relative’s telephone call wanting to pay a visit and introduce his fiancee. For Alice the natural behaviour of the young couple is a revelation, bringing home to her, her own desperate situation and the implacable passage of time. Cast includes: Alice Spaul, Eunice Phelps, George Wood.

results.title: The Visit
results.creator_credit: Julian Biggs, ONF | NFB and Bernard Devlin
results.brief_description: Paul, a young French Canadian, is caught between two ways of life, and must choose for himself between the old and the new. After a two year absence, Paul returns to the Quebec village where he grew up. His father hopes he will stay and take over his boat-building trade. Despite family ties, Paul sees the inevitable change that is coming to the province and responds to the stronger call of the industrial world.

results.title: The Vision of William Blake (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Morse Films, British Film Institute Experimental Film Fund and Guy Brenton
results.brief_description: Filmed in four museums that contain major collections of Blake’s writings and paintings, this documentary by Guy Brenton explores the anguish of Blake’s prophetic world, Music by Ralph Vaughan Williams, and narration and poems read by Bernard Miles and Robert Speight.
